description: Primes p(k) such that p(k) + p(k+3) = p(k+1) + p(k+2).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: Starting from 5, the four consecutive primes are 5, 7, 11, 13; and they satisfy 5 + 13 = 7 + 11. So 5 is in the sequence.
prog: (PARI) isok(p) = {my(k = primepi(p)); (p == prime(k)) && ((prime(k) + prime(k+3)) == (prime(k+1) + prime(k+2)));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 15 2014
author: _Clark Kimberling_
